Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
METHODS OR REFERENCE - TNZ M/4:2006, NZS 4407 :1991 Test 3.8.1
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road
Material source & production properties - Broken Faces (1)
Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
METHODS OR REFERENCE - TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 :1991 Test 3.14
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Aggregate broken face content in each of the 3 aggregate fractions between 37.5mm and 4.75mm ≥ 70% by weight and has 2 or more broken faces
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road

Material source & production properties - Lab tests: Optimum water content (OWC), Solid Density
Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - NZ vibrating hammer compaction test at OWC
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZS 4402: 1986 MDD and W/C Test 4.1.3
a) 1 test per stockpile or new seam
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - MDD as the higher of the two results from lab and field
○ OWC as determined in the lab
○ When sampling stockpile for lab, take NDM for W/C offset. Record moisture content and take sample from beneath NDM to dry in the oven. (Two W/C readings and samples)
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road
Material source & production properties - Maximum Dry Density (MDD)
Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - MDD at OWC – in lab
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZS 4402: 1986 MDD and W/C Test 4.1.3, TNZ B/2: 2005
a) 1 test per stockpile or new seam
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - MDD as the higher of the two results from lab and field
○ Ensure plateau test is done at OWC from Lab Value and with NDM moisture offset
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road
Material source & production properties - Crushing Resistance (1)
Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - TNZ M/4 Crushing Resistance Test
METHODS OR REFERENCE - TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 :1991 Test 3.10
FREQ. - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Crushing resistance must reach 130 kN with less than 10% fines passing 2.36mm sieve
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old

Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - TNZ M/4 Crushing Resistance Test
METHODS OR REFERENCE - TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 :1991 Test 3.10
FREQ. - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Crushing resistance must reach 130 kN with less than 10% fines passing 2.36mm sieve
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old
Material source & production properties - Californian Bearing Ratio (CBR) (1)
Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
FREQ. - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Soaked CBR ≥ 80% when compacted/tested in accordance with either test
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old
Material source & production properties - Californian Bearing Ratio (CBR) (2)
Note: Running course to be produced from the same type and source of material as the basecourse. - PSD (Particle Size Distribution)
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - NZ vibrating hammer compaction test at OMC
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZS 4407: 1991 Test CBR 3.15, TNZ M/4: 2006
FREQ. - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Soaked CBR ≥ 80% when compacted/tested in accordance with either test
INSPECTORATE: Description - Hold Point – All production and source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old

FREQ. - 5 tests per homogeneous lot of up to 1000m2 of laid pavement
